intro: Miconia schlimii, commonly known as the Schlim's miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
